documentation.text:
@notice owner can change timeLock; the new `timeLock` cannot be  lower than `absoluteMinTimeLock`
 @param _newTimeLock Sets the new minimum default `timeLock` in seconds; pending payments maintain their `earliestPayTime`

@notice owner can change the maximum number of seconds`securityGuard` can delay a payment
 @param _maxSecurityGuardDelay The new maximum delay in seconds

params._amount: Amount to be paid in wei
params._name: Brief description of the payment that is authorized
params._paymentDelay: Number of seconds the payment is to be delayed; if this value is below `timeLock` then the `timeLock` determines the delay

returns._0: The Payment ID number for the new authorized payment

params._spender: The address of the contract being authorized

params._idPayment: ID of the payment to be canceled.

params._newEscapeHatchCaller: New address to be assigned to escapeHatchCaller

params._idPayment: The payment ID to be executed

params._absoluteMinTimeLock: The minimum number of seconds `timelock` can be set to, if set to 0 the `owner` can remove the `timeLock` completely
params._escapeHatchCaller: The address of a trusted account or contract to send the ether in this contract
params._escapeHatchDestination: The address of a safe location to send the ether held in this contract to
params._maxSecurityGuardDelay: The maximum number of seconds in total that `securityGuard` can delay a payment so that the owner can cancel the payment if needed
params._securityGuard: Address that will be able to delay the payments beyond the initial timelock requirements; can be set to 0x0 to remove the `securityGuard` functionality
params._timeLock: Initial number of seconds that payments are delayed after they are authorized (a security precaution)

params._delay: The number of seconds to delay the payment
params._idPayment: ID of the payment to be delayed

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._spender: The address of the contract being removed

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._maxSecurityGuardDelay: The new maximum delay in seconds

params._newSecurityGuard: Address of the new security guard

params._newTimeLock: Sets the new minimum default `timeLock` in seconds; pending payments maintain their `earliestPayTime`

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

allowedSpenders.details: The whitelisted addresses allowed to set up && receive payments from this vault

authorizeSpender(address).notice: Called by owner to add an address to the allowedSpenders whitelist

cancelPayment(uint256).notice: Called by owner to cancel a payment

changeEscapeCaller(address).notice: Changes the address assigned to call `escapeHatch()`

collectAuthorizedPayment(uint256).notice: Called by recipient of a payment to receive the ether after the earliestPayTime` has passed

delayPayment(uint256,uint256).notice: Called by Security Guard to delay a payment for a set number of seconds

escapeHatch().notice: Sends all of the eth contained in the contract to the escapeHatchDestinationshould only be called as last resort

numberOfAuthorizedPayments().notice: Returns the total number of authorized payments in this contract

removeSpender(address).notice: Called by owner to remove an address to the allowedSpenders whitelist

setMaxSecurityGuardDelay(uint256).notice: owner can change the maximum number of seconds`securityGuard` can delay a payment

setSecurityGuard(address).notice: Called by owner to set new address of security guard

setTimelock(uint256).notice: owner can change timeLock; the new `timeLock` cannot be  lower than `absoluteMinTimeLock`
